page.title: 01Introduction - Broxwood Area
page.content:
Grid number: 03360252
This block of countryside is almost wholly devoted to farming. It is quiet, undulating and very pretty. Main roads pass outside the area except where the A4112 crosses its south-east corner. Lower Broxwood is the only assemblage of houses big enough to be called a hamlet. The nearest large village is Weobley just south-east of the block, and the nearest town is Kington, about 5 miles away to the north-west.
The following pages contain details of
Landscape, Flora and Fauna, Farming, Industry, Transport, Population, Clubs and Societies, Arts and Crafts and Housing.
